cs145.kersten.assignment1

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs145.kersten.assignment1.GameBoard
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Checkerboard

    public abstract class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    GameBoard is a wrapper around a 2D character array. It does NOT provide bounds checking. This board can be used as a base for many different games.
    Author:
    Andrew Kersten

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private char[][] board
      The 2D character array representing the game board

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameBoard(int boardWidth, int boardHeight)
      Initializes the board to be boardWidth wide and boardHeight tall

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getPiece(int row, int col)
      Returns the character representing the game piece on the board located at row row and column col.
      void setPiece(int row, int col, char piece)
      Sets the character representing the game piece on the board located at row row and column col to piece.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • board

        private char[][] board
        The 2D character array representing the game board

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard(int boardWidth,
         int boardHeight)
        Initializes the board to be boardWidth wide and boardHeight tall
        Parameters:
        boardWidth - is the width of the game board
        boardHeight - is the height of the game board

    • Method Detail

      • getPiece

        public char getPiece(int row,
            int col)
        Returns the character representing the game piece on the board located at row row and column col. It does NOT do any bounds checking. We do not want to silently fail and java will throw the error for us.
        Parameters:
        row - is the row on the board of the character to return
        col - is the column on the board of the character to return
        Returns:
        Returns the character located at row row and column col on the board

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece(int row,
            int col,
            char piece)
        Sets the character representing the game piece on the board located at row row and column col to piece. It does NOT do any bounds checking. We do not want to silently fail and java will throw the error for us.
        Parameters:
        row - is the row on the board to set to piece
        col - is the column on the board to set to piece
        piece - is the character to set the piece located at row row and column col to
